org.da.expressionj.expr
Class CodeBlock

java.lang.Object
  org.da.expressionj.expr.CodeBlock
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Expression, ExpressionType
public class CodeBlock
extends java.lang.Object
implements Expression

A code block containing several "<do something>;", each being one Expression.

Examples

The following expression c=a+b;d=c*2;return d; will perform the following computations:
  • c is the result of a+b
  • d is c * 2
  • return d as the result of the evaluation
The equation will also have two side-effects in this case: set the value for c and d.

The following expression c=a+b;d=c*2; will have exactly the same result.

setParentBlock in interface Expression

getParentBlock

public CodeBlock getParentBlock()
Description copied from interface: Expression
Return the parent expression block if the expression is one of several expressions separated by commas. For example, in the following equation: b=a+2; return b, the two "b=a+2" and "return b" have "b=a+2; return b" as their parent block.

Specified by:
getParentBlock in interface Expression

getVariables

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Variable> getVariables()
Description copied from interface: Expression
Return the variables declared by this expression. Note that this methos will not return any internal variables used by the expression. For example, in the following expression: int c=a+b, only "a" and "b" will be returned.

Specified by:
getVariables in interface Expression

evalAsInt

public int evalAsInt()
Description copied from interface: Expression
Evaluate the expression as an int. The result of the evaluation will be the same as Expression.eval(), but the evaluation engine will be able to optimize the computation by knwoing that the result is an int (primitive valeus are cached internally).

Specified by:
evalAsInt in interface Expression

evalAsFloat

public float evalAsFloat()
Description copied from interface: Expression
Evaluate the expression as a float. The result of the evaluation will be the same as Expression.eval(), but the evaluation engine will be able to optimize the computation by knwoing that the result is a float (primitive valeus are cached internally).

Specified by:
evalAsFloat in interface Expression

evalAsBoolean

public boolean evalAsBoolean()
Description copied from interface: Expression
Evaluate the expression as a boolean. The result of the evaluation will be the same as Expression.eval(), but the evaluation engine will be able to optimize the computation by knwoing that the result is a boolean (primitive valeus are cached internally).

Specified by:
evalAsBoolean in interface Expression

getResultType

public short getResultType()
Description copied from interface: Expression
Return the type of the result for the expression. The type can be:
  • ExpressionType.TYPE_INTEGER: integer
  • ExpressionType.TYPE_FLOAT: float
  • ExpressionType.TYPE_NUMERIC: integer or float value. The runtime actual type may depend on the expression arguments
  • ExpressionType.TYPE_STRING: string
  • ExpressionType.TYPE_DYNAMIC: dynamic type. The runtime actual type may depend on the expression arguments
  • ExpressionType.TYPE_UNDEF: undefined type. The default type, characteristic of an error if entountered.

Specified by:
getResultType in interface Expression

getResultStructure

public short getResultStructure()
Description copied from interface: Expression
Return the structure of the result for the expression. The structure can be:
  • ExpressionType.STRUCT_SCALAR: a scalar value
  • ExpressionType.STRUCT_ARRAY: an array value

Specified by:
getResultStructure in interface Expression
